de.hs_duesseldorf.medien.mi.httphsdronelog.hsdronelog.network.util.json

Class JSONReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hs_duesseldorf.medien.mi.httphsdronelog.hsdronelog.network.util.json.JSONReader

  • public class JSONReader
extends Object
    A JSONReader reads a json formatted String and hands over the data to a JSONReaderListener. So a component can react individually to the parsed data.
    This object will loop through the complete input String and interprets every single character.

      Saves the name of the current json statement
      private Stack<Character> m_signalCharStack
      Saves each '"','{','[' and removes it when it is closed.
      private String m_wordBuffer
      The buffer to check words.

        public JSONReader()

        See Also:
        #parseJSON(JSONReaderListener, String)} for more information.

    • Method Detail

      • parseJSON

        public void parseJSON(JSONReaderListener listener,
                      String jsonString)
               throws InvalidParameterException
        Parses a json formatted String. This method is using a JSONReaderListener to hand over the data.
        Note that the methods from the listener are called directly after reading the specific part of the String. So JSONReaderListener.exceptionThrown(Exception) can occur after receiving some data. If that happens you should discard all the data received so far.
        Parameters:
        listener - The JSONReaderListener instance to handle over the data.
        jsonString - The json formatted string.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - If the listener is null.

      • reset

        private void reset()
        Resets this instance so that the instance is in the same state like after the construction.

      • startParsing

        private void startParsing()
        Starts parsing the json string. This method calls methods from a JSONReaderListener when the specific part of the json was read.

      • signalCharBeginObjectRead

        private void signalCharBeginObjectRead()
        Checks if a new json object starts or the signal char belongs to a name / value and must be handled by defaultHandling() method.

      • signalCharEndObjectRead

        private void signalCharEndObjectRead(int charReadPosition)
                              throws IllegalStateException
        Checks if a new json object ends or the signal char belongs to a name / value and must be handled by defaultHandling() method.
        Parameters:
        charReadPosition - The position of the character read.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this instance is in an illegal state for an operation.

      • signalCharBeginArrayRead

        private void signalCharBeginArrayRead(int charReadPosition)
                               throws IllegalStateException
        Checks if a new json array begins or the signal char belongs to a name / value and must be handled by defaultHandling() method.
        Parameters:
        charReadPosition - The position of the character read.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this instance is in an illegal state for an operation.

      • signalCharEndArrayRead

        private void signalCharEndArrayRead(int charReadPosition)
                             throws IllegalStateException
        Checks if a json array ends or the signal char belongs to a name / value and must be handled by defaultHandling() method.
        Parameters:
        charReadPosition - The position of the character read.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this instance is in an illegal state for an operation.

      • signalCharStartingNameOrValueRead

        private void signalCharStartingNameOrValueRead(int charReadPosition)
                                        throws IllegalStateException
        Checks if a json name or value begins or the signal char belongs to a name / value and must be handled by defaultHandling() method.
        Parameters:
        charReadPosition - The position of the character read.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this instance is in an illegal state for an operation.

      • signalCharValuePartRead

        private void signalCharValuePartRead(int charReadPosition)
                              throws IllegalStateException
        Checks if a json value will follow the last statement or the signal char belongs to a name / value and must be handled by defaultHandling() method.
        Parameters:
        charReadPosition - The position of the character read.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this instance is in an illegal state for an operation.

      • signalCharStatementSeparatorRead

        private void signalCharStatementSeparatorRead(int charReadPosition)
        Checks if a json attribute has not been saved yet and saves it or if the signal char belongs to a name / value and must be handled by defaultHandling() method.
        Parameters:
        charReadPosition - The position of the character read.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this instance is in an illegal state for an operation.

      • checkForInvalidOperation

        private void checkForInvalidOperation(int i)
                               throws IllegalStateException
        Checks if the current state of this instance is legal for a certain operation. This methods checks if the m_signalCharStack is empty and so the only valid operation is to begin a new json object.
        Parameters:
        i - The position of the character read.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this instace is in an illegal state for an operation.

      • checkForLegalJsonString

        private void checkForLegalJsonString()
                              throws IllegalStateException
        Checks if m_jsonString has a valid value. This method does not check for null value.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the jsonString has an invalid value and so this instance is in an illegal state.

      • defaultHandling

        private void defaultHandling()
        The default handling for characters read. This method will add the character to the m_wordBuffer.

      • handOverNewAttribute

        private void handOverNewAttribute()
        Hands over a new json attribute to the m_jsonReaderListener.
